text: hey this is Edgar right I'm the
co-writer and director of the World's
End
it was June the 22nd 1990 this is the
opening 90 seconds of the world's end
it's a prologue so in 1990 we decided to
shoot this on 16 mil and do in-camera
effects like hand cranking and this kind
of stop start feel so it felt like late
80s Early 90s MTV the actors are all
playing younger versions of the leads in
the film which includes Simon Pegg
Martin Freeman Nick Frost the casting
processes that was quite tricky and it's
one of the first things that we did in
casting some of the actors are actually
wearing prosthetic because we wanted to
make them look like their older
counterparts and that I was inspired to
do that after seeing Ryan Johnson's
looper I thought that wasn't it be more
effective than trying to do CGI we
actually shot this sequence for weeks
before we started the main production
because we needed to get the last days
of summer it was really important that
we got some summery days and it was a
particularly bad weather year last year
in the UK in the movie the names of the
pubs are all actually based on real pub
names and we loved the idea that in the
sequence it actually prefigures a lot of
events that happen later in the movie we
wanted the pub names to be like tarot
cards so they tell you something about
what's gonna happen in the movie the
final bar the World's End is is also a
real name of a pub in the UK somewhere
that I used to meet Simon I always just
think it was weird to say the sentence
I'll see you at the World's End so that
pretty much inspired the movie
